alert.note: Alert for Clay; Northwest Nicholas; Southeast Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 24 at 4:49PM EST until January 25 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM EST THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and prior/ongoing snowmelt continues to be possible. Ice jams on area rivers may also produce flooding. * WHERE...Portions of central and southeast West Virginia, including the following counties, in central West Virginia, Clay. In southeast West Virginia, Northwest Nicholas and Southeast Nicholas. * WHEN...From 7 PM EST this evening through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Continuing snowmelt combined with up to an inch and a half of rainfall late tonight through Friday morning will lead to stream and river rises and local high water concerns. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Water levels around ice jams are notoriously unpredictable, and can change quickly with little or no warning. Anyone living or recreating near rivers should pay close attention over the next few days and prepare for additional changes in water levels. You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
